qiskit_aqua.algorithms.adaptive.qsvm package¶

Submodules¶

qiskit_aqua.algorithms.adaptive.qsvm.cost_helpers module¶

qiskit_aqua.algorithms.adaptive.qsvm.cost_helpers.assign_label(measured_key, num_classes)[source]¶

Classes = 2: - If odd number of qubits we use majority vote - If even number of qubits we use parity Classes = 3 - We use part-parity

{ex. for 2 qubits: [00], [01,10], [11] would be the three labels}
Parameters:
  • measured_key (str) – measured key
  • num_classes (int) – number of classes
qiskit_aqua.algorithms.adaptive.qsvm.cost_helpers.cost_estimate(probs, gt_labels, shots=None)[source]¶

Calculate cross entropy # shots is kept since it may be needed in future. :param shots: the number of shots used in quantum computing :type shots: int :param probs: NxK array, N is the number of data and K is the number of class :type probs: numpy.ndarray :param gt_labels: Nx1 array :type gt_labels: numpy.ndarray

Returns:cross entropy loss between estimated probs and gt_labels
Return type:float
qiskit_aqua.algorithms.adaptive.qsvm.cost_helpers.cost_estimate_sigmoid(shots, probs, gt_labels)[source]¶

Calculate sigmoid cross entropy

Parameters:
  • shots (int) – the number of shots used in quantum computing
  • probs (numpy.ndarray) – NxK array, N is the number of data and K is the number of class
  • gt_labels (numpy.ndarray) – Nx1 array
Returns:

sigmoid cross entropy loss between estimated probs and gt_labels
Return type:

float
qiskit_aqua.algorithms.adaptive.qsvm.cost_helpers.return_probabilities(counts, num_classes)[source]¶

Return the probabilities of given measured counts :param counts: N data and each with a dict recording the counts :type counts: [dict] :param num_classes: number of classes :type num_classes: int

Returns:NxK array
Return type:numpy.ndarray

__init__(optimizer, feature_map, var_form, training_dataset, test_dataset=None, datapoints=None, batch_mode=False)[source]¶

Initialize the object :param training_dataset: {‘A’: numpy.ndarray, ‘B’: numpy.ndarray, …} :type training_dataset: dict :param test_dataset: the same format as training_dataset :type test_dataset: dict :param datapoints: NxD array, N is the number of data and D is data dimension :type datapoints: numpy.ndarray :param optimizer: Optimizer instance :type optimizer: Optimizer :param feature_map: FeatureMap instance :type feature_map: FeatureMap :param var_form: VariationalForm instance :type var_form: VariationalForm :param batch_mode: Batch mode for circuit compilation and execution :type batch_mode: boolean

Notes

We used label denotes numeric results and class means the name of that class (str).

  • theta ([numpy.ndarray]) – list of 1-D array, parameters sets for variational form

the circuit

predict(data, quantum_instance=None)[source]¶

Predict the labels for the data.

Parameters:
  • data (numpy.ndarray) – NxD array, N is number of data, D is data dimension
  • quantum_instance (QuantumInstance) – quantum backend with all setting
Returns:

for each data point, generates the predicted probability for each class list: for each data point, generates the predicted label, which with the highest prob
Return type:

[dict]
